Alicia Keys.passage: Alicia Keys (born January 25, 1981) is an American singer, songwriter, and actress. She was raised in the Hell's Kitchen neighborhood of Manhattan, New York. Her second album, The Diary of Alicia Keys (2003), was also a critical and commercial success, spawning the singles 'You Don't Know My Name' and 'Diary', and winning her four more Grammy Awards. In 2007, Keys released her third album, As I Am, which sold 7 million copies worldwide and earned her an additional four Grammy Awards. Her fourth album, The Element of Freedom (2009), sold 2 million copies and earned Keys an additional Grammy Award. In 2012, Keys released her fifth studio album, Girl on Fire, which earned her a further two Grammy Awards. Throughout her career, Keys has won 27 Grammy Awards, making her the second-most awarded female artist in Grammy history, behind only Alison Krauss. In 2014, Keys was a coach on the fifth season of the American reality television series The Voice. In 2016, Keys released her sixth studio album, Here, which debuted atop the Billboard 200 chart and earned her an additional Grammy Award. In 2019, Keys released her seventh studio album, 'Alicia', which debuted atop the Billboard 200 chart and earned her an additional Grammy Award.

Texas.passage: Texas is a state in the United States of America. It is the second largest state by both area and population.
